intro: Schwartzia jimenezii, commonly known as the Mexican velvetleaf, is a shrub native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy, ovate leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds. Schwartzia jimenezii is often found in dry, disturbed habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
